meanings.definition: In a manner lacking intelligence or understanding.
meanings.sent1: She answered the question witlessly, not comprehending the meaning.
meanings.sent2: He walked witlessly into the room, unaware of the surprise waiting for him.
meanings.sent3: The puppy followed the butterfly witlessly, unaware of the mischief it was causing.
meanings.sent4: The detective stumbled witlessly through the case, missing all the crucial clues.
meanings.sent5: The student stared witlessly at the math problem, unable to solve it.

meanings.sent1: The witlessly written joke fell flat with the audience.
meanings.sent2: She gave a witlessly simple answer to the complex question.
meanings.sent3: His witlessly decorated room lacked any sense of style.
meanings.sent4: The witlessly designed machine kept malfunctioning due to its poor construction.
meanings.sent5: The witlessly crafted plan had no chance of success from the start.
